question: Which water body is geographically related to Burundi?
explanation: Lake Tanganyika is geographically related to Burundi, which lies to the south-west of Burundi. Lake Tanganyika is one of the African Great Lakes. It is the second-oldest freshwater lake in the world, the second-largest by volume and second-deepest lake. The mouth of the lake is Congo River which finally drains into the Atlantic Ocean. This lake serves the Democratic Republic of Congo, Tanzania, Burundi and Zambia.
